para: When writing a Naviguide file, only one source type can be used: (w)aypoints, (r)outes, or (t)racks. The input option defines the order by which a non-empty source is searched. Any of 'w', 'r', and 't' letters may be used it most one time in any order.
For example, input=r will write the routes, if any. The default value input=wrt will write the waypoints, if any. Otherwise, the routes, if any. And lastely, the tracks, if any.
